\subsection{Detailed Description}
Include file for S\+DL game controller event handling

In order to use these functions, \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l_8h_a8fc8d35348d7c74bad8392d776c937b8}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Init()}} must have been called with the \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l_8h_ac224a9aa4208de0e9b03948ff9b5fe0a}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+I\+N\+I\+T\+\_\+\+G\+A\+M\+E\+C\+O\+N\+T\+R\+O\+L\+L\+ER}} flag. This causes S\+DL to scan the system for game controllers, and load appropriate drivers.

If you would like to receive controller updates while the application is in the background, you should set the following hint before calling \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l_8h_a8fc8d35348d7c74bad8392d776c937b8}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Init()}}\+: S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+H\+I\+N\+T\+\_\+\+J\+O\+Y\+S\+T\+I\+C\+K\+\_\+\+A\+L\+L\+O\+W\+\_\+\+B\+A\+C\+K\+G\+R\+O\+U\+N\+D\+\_\+\+E\+V\+E\+N\+TS

\subsection{Enumeration Type Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a96d0bda99d806397e4c697241ccffa1c}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a96d0bda99d806397e4c697241ccffa1c}} 
\index{SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}!SDL\_GameControllerAxis@{SDL\_GameControllerAxis}}
\index{SDL\_GameControllerAxis@{SDL\_GameControllerAxis}!SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{SDL\_GameControllerAxis}{SDL\_GameControllerAxis}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily enum \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a96d0bda99d806397e4c697241ccffa1c}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Axis}}}

The list of axes available from a controller

Thumbstick axis values range from S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+J\+O\+Y\+S\+T\+I\+C\+K\+\_\+\+A\+X\+I\+S\+\_\+\+M\+IN to S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+J\+O\+Y\+S\+T\+I\+C\+K\+\_\+\+A\+X\+I\+S\+\_\+\+M\+AX, and are centered within $\sim$8000 of zero, though advanced UI will allow users to set or autodetect the dead zone, which varies between controllers.

Trigger axis values range from 0 to S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+J\+O\+Y\+S\+T\+I\+C\+K\+\_\+\+A\+X\+I\+S\+\_\+\+M\+AX. \mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a9e4d3f8c9c9860064a68a700e0486f98}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a9e4d3f8c9c9860064a68a700e0486f98}}

\subsection{Function Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a62cb682b1c589135cd32cce381d403f8}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a62cb682b1c589135cd32cce381d403f8}} 
\index{SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}!SDL\_GameControllerAddMapping@{SDL\_GameControllerAddMapping}}
\index{SDL\_GameControllerAddMapping@{SDL\_GameControllerAddMapping}!SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{SDL\_GameControllerAddMapping()}{SDL\_GameControllerAddMapping()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily D\+E\+C\+L\+S\+P\+EC int S\+D\+L\+C\+A\+LL S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Add\+Mapping (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{const char $\ast$}]{mapping\+String }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Add or update an existing mapping configuration

\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
1 if mapping is added, 0 if updated, -\/1 on error 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a01da8611222d5648872fbb4440c886af}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a01da8611222d5648872fbb4440c886af}} 
\index{SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}!SDL\_GameControllerAddMappingsFromRW@{SDL\_GameControllerAddMappingsFromRW}}
\index{SDL\_GameControllerAddMappingsFromRW@{SDL\_GameControllerAddMappingsFromRW}!SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{SDL\_GameControllerAddMappingsFromRW()}{SDL\_GameControllerAddMappingsFromRW()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily D\+E\+C\+L\+S\+P\+EC int S\+D\+L\+C\+A\+LL S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Add\+Mappings\+From\+RW (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{struct_s_d_l___r_wops}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+R\+Wops}} $\ast$}]{rw,  }\item[{int}]{freerw }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

To count the number of game controllers in the system for the following\+: int n\+Joysticks = \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__joystick_8h_a2ab130eaa28f8e3bd544a5432041a311}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Num\+Joysticks()}}; int n\+Game\+Controllers = 0; for (int i = 0; i $<$ n\+Joysticks; i++) \{ if (S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Is\+Game\+Controller(i)) \{ n\+Game\+Controllers++; \} \}

Using the S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+H\+I\+N\+T\+\_\+\+G\+A\+M\+E\+C\+O\+N\+T\+R\+O\+L\+L\+E\+R\+C\+O\+N\+F\+IG hint or the \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a62cb682b1c589135cd32cce381d403f8}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Add\+Mapping()}} you can add support for controllers S\+DL is unaware of or cause an existing controller to have a different binding. The format is\+: guid,name,mappings

Where G\+U\+ID is the string value from \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__joystick_8h_a7f615ef8040e7e9de3af6482d8d9908c}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Joystick\+Get\+G\+U\+I\+D\+String()}}, name is the human readable string for the device and mappings are controller mappings to joystick ones. Under Windows there is a reserved G\+U\+ID of \char`\"{}xinput\char`\"{} that covers any X\+Input devices. The mapping format for joystick is\+: bX -\/ a joystick button, index X h\+X.\+Y -\/ hat X with value Y aX -\/ axis X of the joystick Buttons can be used as a controller axis and vice versa.

This string shows an example of a valid mapping for a controller \char`\"{}03000000341a00003608000000000000,\+P\+S3 Controller,a\+:b1,b\+:b2,y\+:b3,x\+:b0,start\+:b9,guide\+:b12,back\+:b8,dpup\+:h0.\+1,dpleft\+:h0.\+8,dpdown\+:h0.\+4,dpright\+:h0.\+2,leftshoulder\+:b4,rightshoulder\+:b5,leftstick\+:b10,rightstick\+:b11,leftx\+:a0,lefty\+:a1,rightx\+:a2,righty\+:a3,lefttrigger\+:b6,righttrigger\+:b7\char`\"{}, Load a set of mappings from a seekable S\+DL data stream (memory or file), filtered by the current \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__platform_8h_a55905e7a299221262fc655e785ab2dc7}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Get\+Platform()}} A community sourced database of controllers is available at \href{https://raw.github.com/gabomdq/SDL_GameControllerDB/master/gamecontrollerdb.txt}{\texttt{ https\+://raw.\+github.\+com/gabomdq/\+S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+D\+B/master/gamecontrollerdb.\+txt}}

If {\ttfamily freerw} is non-\/zero, the stream will be closed after being read.

\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
number of mappings added, -\/1 on error 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a97fcf011947b35403c7d5319673a35e9}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a97fcf011947b35403c7d5319673a35e9}}

\index{SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}!SDL\_GameControllerEventState@{SDL\_GameControllerEventState}}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily D\+E\+C\+L\+S\+P\+EC int S\+D\+L\+C\+A\+LL S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Event\+State (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{state }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Enable/disable controller event polling.

If controller events are disabled, you must call \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a92fe68241a17b60b2240c04d01b73e6b}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Update()}} yourself and check the state of the controller when you want controller information.

The state can be one of \+::\+S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Q\+U\+E\+RY, \+::\+S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+E\+N\+A\+B\+LE or \+::\+S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+I\+G\+N\+O\+RE. \mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a34e43c763202a2d7124f24fdaf508a2a}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a34e43c763202a2d7124f24fdaf508a2a}}

\index{SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}!SDL\_GameControllerGetAxis@{SDL\_GameControllerGetAxis}}
\index{SDL\_GameControllerGetAxis@{SDL\_GameControllerGetAxis}!SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{SDL\_GameControllerGetAxis()}{SDL\_GameControllerGetAxis()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily D\+E\+C\+L\+S\+P\+EC Sint16 S\+D\+L\+C\+A\+LL S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Get\+Axis (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller $\ast$}]{gamecontroller,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a96d0bda99d806397e4c697241ccffa1c}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Axis}}}]{axis }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Get the current state of an axis control on a game controller.

The state is a value ranging from -\/32768 to 32767 (except for the triggers, which range from 0 to 32767).

The axis indices start at index 0. \mbox{\Hypertarget{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a44a5320a7241b218417d9bfb995907d7}\label{_s_d_l__gamecontroller_8h_a44a5320a7241b218417d9bfb995907d7}}

Get the current state of a game controller sensor.

The number of values and interpretation of the data is sensor dependent. See \mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__sensor_8h}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+sensor.\+h}} for the details for each type of sensor.

\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

0 or -\/1 if an error occurred.

\index{SDL\_GameControllerOpen@{SDL\_GameControllerOpen}!SDL\_gamecontroller.h@{SDL\_gamecontroller.h}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{SDL\_GameControllerOpen()}{SDL\_GameControllerOpen()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily D\+E\+C\+L\+S\+P\+EC S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller$\ast$ S\+D\+L\+C\+A\+LL S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Game\+Controller\+Open (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{joystick\+\_\+index }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Open a game controller for use. The index passed as an argument refers to the N\textquotesingle{}th game controller on the system. This index is not the value which will identify this controller in future controller events. The joystick\textquotesingle{}s instance id (\mbox{\hyperlink{_s_d_l__joystick_8h_a3c3d32500cb08f76ee8077983912c0bd}{S\+D\+L\+\_\+\+Joystick\+ID}}) will be used there instead.

\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A controller identifier, or N\+U\+LL if an error occurred. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

Start a rumble effect Each call to this function cancels any previous rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

{\em low\+\_\+frequency\+\_\+rumble} & The intensity of the low frequency (left) rumble motor, from 0 to 0x\+F\+F\+FF \\
\hline
{\em high\+\_\+frequency\+\_\+rumble} & The intensity of the high frequency (right) rumble motor, from 0 to 0x\+F\+F\+FF \\
\hline
{\em duration\+\_\+ms} & The duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
0, or -\/1 if rumble isn\textquotesingle{}t supported on this controller 
\end{DoxyReturn}
